1: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,\q
2:
If anyone tries to speak with you, will you be impatient?\q But who can stop himself from speaking?
\q
3:
See, you have instructed many;\q you have strengthened weak hands.


\q
4:
Your words have supported him who was falling;\q you have made feeble knees firm.
\q
5:
But now trouble has come to you, and you are weary;\q it touches you, and you are troubled.
\q
6:
Is not your fear your confidence,\q and the integrity of your ways your hope?


\q
7:
Think about this, please: Who has ever perished when innocent?\q Or when were the upright people ever cut off?
\q
8:
According to what I have seen, those who plow iniquity\q and sow trouble reap it.
\q
9:
By the breath of God they perish;\q by the blast of his anger they are consumed.


\q
10:
The roaring of the lion, the voice of the fierce lion,\q the teeth of the young lionsâ€”they are broken.
\q
11:
The old lion perishes for lack of victims;\q the cubs of the lioness are scattered everywhere.


\q
12:
Now a certain matter was secretly brought to me,\q and my ear received a whisper about it.
\q
13:
Then came thoughts from visions in the night,\q when deep sleep falls on people.


\q
14:
It was at night when fear and trembling came upon me,\q and all my bones shook.
\q
15:
Then a spirit passed before my face,\q and the hair of my flesh stood up.


\q
17:
"Can a mortal man be more righteous than God?\q Can a man be more pure than his Maker?


\q
18:
See, if God puts no trust in his servants;\q if he accuses his angels of folly,
\q
19:
how much more is this true of those who live in houses of clay,\q whose foundation is in the dust,
\q who are crushed sooner than a moth?


\q
20:
Between morning and evening they are destroyed;\q they perish forever without anyone noticing them.
\q
21: Are not their tent cords plucked up among them?\q They die; they die without wisdom.
